alert.note: Alert for Morris; Somerset (New Jersey) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly (New Jersey, Delaware, Southeastern Pennsylvania)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 12 at 8:36PM EST until January 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in New Jersey... Passaic River At Millington affecting Somerset and Morris Counties. For the Passaic River...including Millington...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL MONDAY EVENING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Passaic River at Millington. * WHEN...Until Monday evening. * IMPACTS...At 7.0 feet, Backyards floods along Madison Street in Long Hill Township due to backwater. At 7.5 feet, Flooding along Morristown Road in the Gillette section on Long Hill Township. Flooding along Warren Avenue in the Stirling Section of Long Hill Township. Both due to backwater. At 8.0 feet, Bungalow Terrace in Millington begins to flood. Lord Sterling Road in Millington begins to flood. Parking lots along Valley Road in Long Hill Township begin to flood. At 8.5 feet, Commercial properties along Valley Road in Long Hill Township begin to flood. At 9.0 feet, Flooding along Lord Sterling Road in Millington increases. Old Forge Road in Millington begins to flood. Residential evacuations possible in Long Hill Township. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:30 PM EST Friday the stage was 7.7 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage once again tomorrow morning to a crest of 8.3 feet tomorrow evening. It will then fall below flood stage Sunday afternoon. - Flood stage is 8.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 8.2 feet on 12/20/2023. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood && Stream Fld Observed Fcsts (7 pm) Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Sat Sun Stg Time Date Passaic River Millington 8.0 7.7 Fri 7 pm 8.3 7.9 8.3 7pm 1/13 &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Turn around...don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/phi. The next statement will be issued Saturday morning at 845 AM EST.
